Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2013 12:20AM SandyinPa wrote: Thank you all for the feeback! You are all so unbelievable. I had no support system until now. It seems like the most popular location for the port is the chest just above the breast. I heard one woman had hers in her stomache. Anyone have it put anywhere else? I worry about it getting infected. Is there anything I can do to prevent that?
Posts.Title: Is a port necessary? SandyinPa Blossoms

Posts.Content: SandyinPa wrote: Hi all, I understand that removing the breasts when the cancer is located just in the breasts is to prevent it from spreading to the rest of the body, but once it has spread to other areas what is the point of removing the breasts? Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The point of removing breasts at Stage IV? SandyinPa macyhen111

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2013 09:48PM SandyinPa wrote: Hi Heidi, I haven't heard this term of reseeding. Do other parts of your body with cancer reseed? Or just the origin of the cancer? What is your understanding of the term? Thanks for the feedback!
Posts.Title: The point of removing breasts at Stage IV? SandyinPa macyhen111

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2013 09:43PM - edited Apr 9, 2013 09:45PM by SandyinPa So, there can be reseeding from where the cancer began? I just wonder if the chemo is or can kill the cancer in other parts of my body that aren't being removed then why can't it kill the cancer in my breast too? I don't really care about having them. Fine they can go. But surgery is always serious and I just want to make sure it's the best thing for the healing of my body. I have read several/many posts by women who have been around for a long time who had IBC and they all did the same plan; chemo, radiation, remove breasts, chemo again. Are there studies on this anywhere? Where do the doctors get their game plan from? Presumably studies? By the way, thank you everyone for your feedback.
Posts.Title: The point of removing breasts at Stage IV? SandyinPa macyhen111

Posts.Content: SandyinPa wrote: Has anyone been diagnosed with this? Or know anything about it? I was diagnosed with this in 2001 and I got a second and third opinionn. I told my PCP that the surgeons had conflicting opinions, what should I do? He said I could do watchful waiting. That's what I did. My mammogams and sonagrams were all good for years. I though maybe it was a misdiagnosis. No one referred me to an oncologist or suggested additional radiological testing. Log in to post a reply
